Language.Sentence: The Full calendar type produces an object displayed as a calendar, that allows creating, editing, viewing and deleting the events.
The order of rendering the object on the page. The objects with identical values of the Hierarchy attribute are rendered in the order they are written in the XML-file of the VDOM application.
The visibility of the object. In any case the object will exist on the web page, this attribute only makes it invisible.

The position in visual hierarchy of objects. If you have several objects in one container situated on each other, the value of 'Z-Index' attribute indicates the order of their displaying. The larger the value is, the upper the object is situated.
Spacing in pixels between the object and the top border of the container, in which the object is situated.
Spacing in pixels between the object and the left border of the container, in which the object is situated.
The width of the object in pixels.
The height of the object in pixels.
The list of events, which are represented as \href{www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2445.txt}{iCalendar} objects.
The way of displaying the object on loading.
The initial date in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format, which is used on loading the object.
The format of displaying the time. If it is set to 12, the time will be displayed as '11am' and '8.30pm'; if it is set to 24, the time will be displayed as '11.00' and '20.30'.
The day of the week that is displayed first.
The names of the days of the week, must be entered through commas without spaces.
The short names of the days of the week, must be entered through commas without spaces.
The short names of the months, must be entered through commas without spaces.
The names of the months, must be entered through commas without spaces.
The possibility of modifying the events. If it is set to 'Yes', the events can be modified, if 'No'---cannot.
The first hour that will be visible in the scroll pane. The values must be from 0-23, where 0=midnight, 1=1am and so on. The user will be able to scroll upwards to see events before this time.
Define whether the 'all-day' slot is displayed at the top of the calendar or not.
The title of the 'all-day' slot at the top of the calendar.
Allow a user to highlight multiple days or timeslots by clicking and dragging.
The frequency of displaying time slots, in minutes.

Loading data dynamically, defines in what case a request for a new list of events will be sent to the server. If it is set to 'No', a request is sent each time some change of date/view takes place; if to 'Yes'---a request is sent each time a transition to the next/previous month takes place.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be integer from 0 to 99
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
Incorrect value, must be positive integer
First day: value should be between 0 and 6
enter list with names of weekdays.
enter list with names of weekdays.
enter list with names of weekdays.
enter list with names of weekdays.
Change the value of the 'View' attribute.
Move the object to a new position.
Set new value of the 'Z-Index' attribute.
Go to the next month, week, or year (depending on the value of the 'View' attribute).
Go to the previous month, week or year (depending on the value of the 'View' attribute).
Resize the object's width and height.
Add events source dynamically, except the events with the recurrence rule. Events will be immediately fetched from this source and placed on the calendar.
Add events source dynamically, including the events with the recurrence rule. Events will be immediately fetched from this source and placed on the calendar.
Hierarchie de l'objet, ordre de chargement de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Niveau de superposition de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Distance depuis le bord haut de l'objet parent en pixels
Distance depuis le bord gauche de l'objet parent en pixels
Hierarchie de l'objet, ordre de chargement de l'objet par rapport aux autres
The initial date when the calendar loads.
Determines the time-text that will be displayed on each event.
The day that each week begins.
Determines whether the events on the calendar can be modified.
The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar.
Determines if the "all-day" slot is displayed at the top of the calendar.
The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar.
Allows a user to highlight multiple days or timeslots by clicking and dragging.
The frequency for displaying time slots, in minutes.
Valeur Incorrecte, doit etre comprise entre 0 et 99
Кнопка в виде ссылки или изображения
Расстояние от верхней границы родительского контейнера до объекта в пикселях
Расстояние от левой границы родительского контейнера до объекта в пикселях
Determines the time-text that will be displayed on each event.
The day that each week begins.
Determines whether the events on the calendar can be modified.
The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar.
Determines if the "all-day" slot is displayed at the top of the calendar.
The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar.
Allows a user to highlight multiple days or timeslots by clicking and dragging.
The frequency for displaying time slots, in minutes.
Неправильное значение, должно быть целое число от 0 до 99
Неправильное значение, должно быть целое положительное число
Неправильное значение, должно быть целое положительное число
Неправильное значение, должно быть целое положительное число
